intro: Corydalis heterocarpa var. brachystyla, commonly known as the short-stemmed corydalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fumariaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of China, where it thrives in temperate climates. The plant features delicate, spurred flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, and it produces slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged alternately along the stem, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This variant is valued in horticulture for its unique floral display and adaptability to various garden conditions.
